main event: A female civilian reported sighting two bright, tube-shaped, noiseless objects flying at the same altitude and speed as commercial aircraft near Knoxville, Tennessee on 27 October 1949. Weather balloons were also released on that day as per the United States Weather Bureau.
interesting points: The objects were described as tube-shaped, noiseless, and about a yard in length, resembling airplanes when the sun shined on them.
No openings, vapor trails, or exhaust were visible, and no sound was emitted from the objects.
Significant wind data at various altitudes was provided, indicating the level of detail in the report.
Debris resembling spider web and ashes was observed falling from the sky after the sightings.
The witness reported experiencing a bitter taste in her mouth and throat, along with a sense of fear, after seeing the objects.
